title: V. K. Pandian’s wife takes voluntary retirement from IAS
content: Sujata Rout Karthikeyan, who led the Mission Shakti department under the BJD government, was accused by the BJP of influencing women self-help groups into supporting the BJD. During her stint in the department, she encouraged entrepreneurship among women, and credit linkage to SHGs rose from ₹500 crore to ₹15,000 crore in seven years.

title: Plan to develop IT hub near Kozhikode railway station, says Union Minister George Kurian
content: 27,100 sq. ft plot on the western side of the station will be developed as the IT hub, says George Kurian

title: SPV to spearhead mega road infra projects worth ₹73,200 crore over next 5 years
content: The budget said a Detailed Project Report has been prepared for a tunnel road between Hebbal and Silk Board at a cost of ₹17,780 crore, “set to be implemented this year”. DPR is also underway for another tunnel between K.R. Puram and Mysuru Road.

title: South Africa most dangerous country to drive, India ranks 49th among 53 surveyed
content: For the fourth year in a row, Norway is the safest country in the world for driving, while South Africa maintained its last position in the list for the second consecutive year

title: Green tag for six tourism destinations in Munnar
content: Officials at  Munnar Hydel Park, Upcycle Park, Botanical Garden, Rose Garden, Children’s Park, and Eravikulam National Park have been directed to ensure that green protocol is complied with

title: Constable facing criminal charges suspended in Annamayya district
content: Accused found to be involved in five criminal cases, including two at the Chinnamandem police station in 2017, and an attempted murder case at Ramapuram police station in 2018, among others

title: Main accused arrested in gang-rape case in Raebareli
content: Police have also booked another man who allegedly threatened the woman over phone of consequences if she told anyone about the inciden

title: Collector moots action plan to boost diary production in Chittoor
content: Strengthening the dairy sector will also create a sustainable income for the farmers and help them overcome the hardships faced due to the unpredictable climatic conditions in agriculture, says Sumit Kumar

title: Over 1,000 Dead, 2,376 Injured: Myanmar-Thailand Quakes Flatten Buildings
content: A massive earthquake struck Myanmar and parts of neighbouring Thailand, leaving a trail of destruction and a mounting death count. As of Saturday, the death count in Myanmar and Thailand is over 1,000.

title: Live: 50 Trapped Under Collapsed Bangkok Building, Help Sought From Abroad
content: Myanmar, Thailand Earthquake Live Updates: The death count from a massive earthquake in Myanmar has jumped to 1,002, with 2,376 people injured, the country's ruling junta said Saturday.

title: Foreign Fund, Salaries In Lakhs To Girls: Noida Couple's Porn Racket Busted
content: A couple in Noida, foreign funding, adult entertainment - a major online pornography racket was busted, uncovering an illegal network that stretched beyond international borders.

title: Is Elon Musk Planning To Quit Trump's DOGE Team? Here's What He Said
content: US President Donald Trump's billionaire ally Elon Musk has signalled that he is planning to step down from his cost-cutting role at the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) by the end of May after reducing the US deficit by $1 trillion.

title: Delhi Earned Rs 5,000 Crore From Tax On Liquor, Rs 200 Crore From Milk
content: Over Rs 5,000 crore was collected from taxes on liquor in the current financial year and just Rs 210 crore from milk and milk products, the Delhi government has told the Assembly

title: "You Know PM Modi Was...": Donald Trump Replies To India Tariff Question
content: Trump had earlier said that India was a very high-tariff nation and reciprocal tariffs on countries that impose levies on American goods would kick in on April 2.

title: Why US Is Asking Hundreds Of International Students To Self-Deport
content: Hundreds of international students studying in the US have received emails from the US Department of State (DOS), telling them to self-deport as their F-1 visas (student visas) have been revoked owing to campus activism.

title: Air Force Civil Engineer Shot Dead At His Home In Prayagraj
content: An unknown person shot at the engineer from the window while he was sleeping in his room in Engineers Colony inside the Air Force Station, Puramufti Station House Officer (SHO) Manoj Singh said.

title: IPL LIVE: MI Brutally Leave Out Uncapped Gem Who Took 3/32 In Last Game
content: Gujarat Titans vs Mumbai Indians LIVE Score, IPL 2025 LIVE: MI captain Hardik Pandya was not booed by the GT fans on his return to his old home stadium.

title: "Will Probably Never Come Back": Tourist's Viral Post On Goa Horror
content: Two locals on a scooty allegedly followed the tourist to the railway station, blocked his car and threatened to smash his windshield.

title: Carpenter's Daughter Tops Bihar Board Class 10 Exam With 98% Marks
content: Bihar Board 10th Result 2025: The Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) announced the Class 10 results today at 12 noon. A total of 12,79,294 students have passed.

title: Open Jeep, Gun, 'Mehbooba Mehbooba': Reel Stunt Lands Man In Trouble
content: An air rifle, an open jeep and 'Mehbooba Mehbooba' from Sholay combined may work for a movie, but a man in Hyderabad tried to copy it for a social media reel and got a police case along with views.

title: "Nothing Really Matters Anymore": Fans Upset Over Studio Ghibli-Style AI Art
content: OpenAI said the latest GPT‑4o model takes a "conservative approach" to mimic the aesthetics of individual artists.

title: Meghalaya regional party suspends MLA, four others
content: The Voice of the People Party cited anti-party activities to take action against Adelbert Nongrum, who represents the North Shillong Assembly constituency

title: ED files chargesheet in Mukkunnimala illegal granite mining case
content: Chargesheet filed against 12 accused in a case pertaining to corruption in converting plantation land to granite quarries

title: DMK stages protest in Kovilpatti over unpaid job scheme funds
content: Kanimozhi leads the protest accusing the Union government of not keeping its promise of releasing ₹4,034 crore due to Tamil Nadu to enable payment of wages

title: Farmer’s daughter topped Bihar Board matriculation exam
content: Altogether 15,58,077 students appeared in the exam out of which 8,05,392 were girls and 7,52,685 were boys

title: Assam Advocate General resigns from bar association over Gauhati High Court relocation
content: Devajit Saikia said his position demands that he stand by the State government’s decision to shift the court from its present location, while the bar association is opposed to the decision.

title: Audit report flags rule violations in correction of internal marks at Calicut varsity
content: Internal marks have been corrected based on at least 22 applications filed by students pursuing various courses, says report

title: Will strengthen TDP as a major political force in country, says Anantapur MP
content: Ambica G. Lakshminarayana, along with Anantapur Urban MLA Daggubati Venkateswara Prasad and party district president Venkatasivudu Yadav, lays foundation stone for the TDP office for the Urban constituency on the occasion of the party foundation day

title: Kudumbashree summer camps for Balasabha children
content: The fete will be held at various levels, beginning with ward-level gathering of children up to the district-level summer camp and a State-level event

title: "CSK Don't Have Guts...": Ex-India Star's Huge Claim As Dhoni Bats At No. 9
content: MS Dhoni walked in to bat when Chennai Super Kings were tottering at 99/7, needing 98 runs to win in just 28 balls against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: 65-Year-Old Man Beheaded, Torso Burnt During 'Black Magic' In Bihar: Cops
content: A 65-year-old man was allegedly killed and his torso was burnt in a 'Holika Dahan' fire as part of 'black magic' rituals in Bihar's Aurangabad district, a police officer said.

title: Maoist With Rs 25 Lakh Bounty Among 17 Killed In Chhattisgarh Encounter
content: In a major success for security forces, a high-ranking commander was among 17 Maoists killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district on Saturday.

title: Preliminary post-mortem report suggests multiple injuries on face, hands of pastor, says Eluru Range Inspector-General of Police Ashok Kumar
content: The available evidences and the preliminary report will be sent for pathological investigation to identify the nature and cause of injuries, he says

title: Gram sabhas discuss rainwater harvesting to mark ‘World Water Day’
content: Meetings were held in 204 villages in Tirunelveli district; District Collector appeals to the peple living villages to ensure that their children studied school till Class XII

title: SC to hear Mahatma Gandhi’s great-grandson against Gujarat’s ‘development’ of Sabarmati Ashram
content: Tushar Gandhi has appealed against a September 8, 2022 decision of the Gujarat High Court, which rejected his plea against the State government’s proposed transformation of the ashram

title: Following right-wing backlash, makers of ‘L2: Empuraan’ to make 17 ‘voluntary cuts’
content: Although Kerala BJP leaders say the party is not part of any campaign against the film, many associated with it and RSS mouthpiece Organiser continue to make statements against it

title: Kodikunnil Suresh calls for ‘Clean Pampa Mission’
content: He raises the matter in the Lok Sabha, seeks conservation of the Pampa river on the lines of Namami Gange programme

title: NDA rule got Bihar out of ‘jungle raj’ of the past: Nadda
content: Lauding the State, the BJP leader and Union Health Minister said Bihar had a ‘special aura and dynamism’

title: Housing, drinking water get priority in Alappuzha municipal Budget
content: The ₹9.6-crore surplus Budget, with a revenue of ₹219.34 crore and an expenditure of ₹209.74 crore, proposes the formation of a municipal-level defence force to deal with drug menace.

title: OIL research centre near national park is a bad idea: Assam activist to Centre
content: Oil India Limited was recently granted permission to establish the centre in the eco-sensitive zone of the Dibru-Saikhowa National Park

title: Andhra Pradesh government mulls a more simplified regulatory framework for development of agricultural land
content: It has decided to repeal the A.P. Agricultural Land (Conversion for Non-Agricultural Purposes) Act of 2006 to avoid duplication and facilitate a more efficient process, says Sisodia, Special Chief Secretary, Revenue

title: Thiruvananthapuram airport to resume full-fledged operations from Sunday
content: The airport was partially closed for the last 75 days as part of mandatory maintenance works. Recarpeting of 3.4-kilometre-long and 60-metre-wide runway completed in a record time

title: Demand to withdraw ‘illegal’ suspension of teachers
content: Jana Vignana Vedika, JAC of teachers’ associations urge government to remove Srikakulam DEO for harassing teachers with ‘illegal suspension’

title: Two naval ships on way to Myanmar, field hospital to be airlifted: MEA on ‘Operation Brahma’
content: Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said in a briefing that two more Indian naval ships would follow under this humanitarian assistance operation.

title: Mysuru achieves MGNREGA target with over 24 lakh man-days for 2024-25
content: An official statement noted that Mysuru had achieved 101.83% of its target for 2024-25. A total of 2,77,379 beneficiaries had availed themselves of the scheme.

title: More trouble for Kunal Kamra, three cases filed against him in Mumbai
content: One of the complaints was filed by the Mayor of Jalgaon city, while the other two complaints came from a hotelier and a businessman from Nashik, as per the Mumbai Police

title: Concern in Karnataka over possible lifting of night traffic ban through Bandipur; campaigns planned
content: The ban, in effect since 2010, has helped reduce death of wild animals run over by speeding vehicles, apart from providing reprieve from habitat disturbance at night.

title: BEML Palakkad launches high mobility vehicle
content: HMV 12x12 is engineered for extreme terrains and challenging climatic conditions, making it a vital asset for defence operations

title: Former HC judge Nirmal Yadav acquitted in 2008 cash-at-judge's door case
content: Defence counsel Vishal Garg said the court acquitted former Justice Nirmal Yadav and four others. There were a total five accused in the case, one of whom died during the trial

title: Farm loan waiver: Maharashtra govt committed to fulfill all poll promises, says Shinde
content: Eknath Shinde's assurance comes a day after Deputy CM Ajit Pawar advised farmers to pay their crop loan instalments on time rather than awaiting a loan waiver announcement, citing the State's current financial constraints

title: Kunal Kamra funded by 'anti-India' organisations abroad, claims Nirupam
content: Nirupam claimed Kunal Kamra received ₹4 crore from donors based in Canada, Australia, the U.S., Saudi Arabia and other Arab countries

title: Belagavi elderly couple death: Cyber criminals may have extorted money from them for months, say police
content: Officers checking the mobile phones and the family bank accounts have also traced a long list of payments the deceased Diego Nazareth made to online gambling sites over several months.

title: Unacceptable that children have to wear masks to play outside due to pollution: SC judge Justice Vikram Nath
content: “This is an urgent call for action, a signal that we must come together to regulate emissions, invest in cleaner technologies and think of sustainable transport options that allow economic progress without compromising the air we breathe,” he said

title: IRCTC case: Lalu Prasad, Rabri Devi, Tejashvi Yadav seek discharge
content: The three claimed before the judge that the allegations levelled against them by the CBI were false, selective and motivated, adding that the central probe agency lacked evidence to prosecute them in the case

title: ‘Merciless’ BJP government seeks to wind up MGNREGA, alleges T.N. CM Stalin
content: He alleged that the BJP government, which had “waived off lakhs of crores borrowed by corporate houses through a single signature”, was not ready to release money for the poor

title: India, U.S. officials conclude round of talks on proposed trade pact: Sources
content: India and the U.S. are aiming to conclude the first phase of the agreement by the fall of 2025 (September-October)

title: Solar PV module manufacturing capacity to reach 125 GW by 2030, says Pralhad Joshi
content: India’s solar manufacturing capacity to reach 125 GW by 2030, emerging as a global renewable energy leader.

title: G.K. Vasan demands white paper on ‘irregularities’ in TASMAC
content: Accusing the DMK government of failing to fulfil its promises to government employees, teachers, and transport workers, Mr. Vasan said the law and order situation had deteriorated in the State

title: AIIMS Delhi performs rare keyhole surgery for pancreatic cancer in a child
content: The 11-year old became the youngest patient worldwide to undergo this complex procedure entirely by laparoscopic route.

title: Fatal head injuries are declining with helmet use, but there is still a long way to go, say doctors
content: For every death in a road traffic accident, there are around 50 who meet with non-fatal accidents and suffer head injuries that may take years to heal, say doctors, calling for stricter enforcement of helmet regulations among all riders and pillion riders

title: India sends 80 NDRF personnel to quake-hit Myanmar
content: Commandant P.K. Tiwary of the 8th NDRF battalion based in Ghaziabad will lead the Urban Search And Rescue team.

title: In Kerala, stricter driving tests prove a bumpy ride as pass rates drop to 52%
content: As part of tightening driving test process, MVD had put a cap on the number of tests to be conducted under a motor vehicle inspector to 40 per day

title: Two Maoists from Chhattisgarh involved in recruitment arrested in ASR district in Andhra Pradesh
content: The duo had been actively involved in the recruitment of new members for the outlawed CPI (Maoist), said ASR Superintendent of Police

title: MP govt changes ‘unemployed’ to ‘aspirational youth’; opposition fumes
content: The state’s Rojgar Portal used the term “Aakanshi Yuva” while listing the number of unemployed youths in Madhya Pradesh and displayed their numbers as more than 29.37 lakh.

title: Jagjit Singh Dallewal has not ended indefinite fast, says farmer leader
content: Countering the Punjab government's claims, farmer leader Abhimanyu Kohar said Jagjit Dallewal had made it clear he would take water only after all the farmers are released.

title: Plans afoot to promote natural farming and local crop varieties in Nandyal district of A.P.
content: Horticulture crops were being grown in 48,000 hectares and the administration is trying to increase the extent of the crops by another 10,000 hectares, District Collector said

title: Kathua encounter: J&K deputy CM says conspiracies hatched from across border ‘killing our children’
content: Mr. Abdullah, Mr. Choudhary and DGP were also seen expressing their condolences to the bereaved family.

title: BJP's 'cronyism' caused banking sector crisis, junior employees suffering: Rahul Gandhi
content: The Congress leader shared a video of his meeting with a delegation of ex-ICICI bank employees, who he said have suffered due to the "mismanagement"

title: Kodagu quadruple murder: Police nab accused in Kerala
content: Girish (38) had hacked to death his wife Nagi (32), their stepdaughter Cauvery (7), and Nagi’s grandparents, Kariya and Gauri, both above 70 years of age.

title: Wealth of Telangana is TDP’s contribution, says Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: The TDP had ushered in the welfare era under the stewardship of NTR in a manner which no other State could do, Chanddrababu Naidu said at the TDP Formation Day celebrations

title: Houston survives on 'beautiful' last-second play
content: A perfectly executed inbounds play gave No. 1 Houston a 62-60 win over Purdue and a spot in the Elite Eight.

title: 'Generational' talent Betts keeps No. 1 UCLA rolling
content: Lauren Betts had 31 points and 10 rebounds as UCLA rolled past Ole Miss 76-62 to advance to the Elite Eight for the first time since 2018.

title: Betts revels in walk-off HR after emotional week
content: The emotions spilled out of Mookie Betts following Friday's walk-off homer, which capped an emotional start to the season in which an illness caused him to shed almost 20 pounds.

title: Dominant Morrow puts LSU in 3rd straight Elite 8
content: With Flau'Jae Johnson struggling, Aneesah Morrow carried the load with 30 points and 19 rebounds as LSU topped NC State 80-73 for its third straight Elite Eight appearance.

title: Gottlieb defends MSU: JuJu not hurt on dirty play
content: USC coach Lindsay Gottlieb condemned the online bullying against Mississippi State's Chandler Prater, saying she did not believe JuJu Watkins' ACL tear was the result of a dirty play.

title: Giannis on LeBron's praise: Unfair to compare eras
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo appreciated LeBron James' take that the Bucks star could have scored 250 points in a game if he had played in the 1970s but said "you can't compare this era with that era."

title: Liu ends U.S. drought, wins figure skating worlds
content: Alysa Liu dethroned three-time defending champion Kaori Sakamoto to become the first American women's figure skating world champion since 2006.

title: UCLA lands MWC Player of Year Dent from portal
content: Guard Donovan Dent, who averaged 20.4 points and 6.5 assists for New Mexico this season, has committed to UCLA after entering the transfer portal.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: NHL playoff watch: Guide to a pivotal 11-game Saturday
content: Here's what's at stake in each matchup, plus updated playoff projections, draft lottery standings and more.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Latest updated poll, plus each team's strength of schedule
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted, along with each team's slate through April 17.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Brazil fires coach Dorival after loss to Argentina
content: Brazil has dismissed head coach Dorival Júnior following Tuesday's deflating loss to rivals Argentina, Brazil's Football Confederation (CBF) announced Friday.

title: Ex-Timber awarded $20M in malpractice lawsuit
content: Former New Zealand international Jake Gleeson has won a medical malpractice lawsuit against Portland Timbers team doctor Richard H. Edelson, with a jury awarding him over $20 million.

title: Osasuna appeal, say Barça player was ineligible
content: Osasuna filed an appeal with the Spanish football federation (RFEF) on Friday stating Barcelona should not have fielded defender Iñigo Martínez in their LaLiga game over a technicality as he sat out Spain's matches with an injury.

title: USWNT's Davidson (knee) exits Gotham FC draw
content: NJ/NY Gotham FC and U.S. women's national team defender Tierna Davidson will be evaluated upon returning to New Jersey after suffering a left knee injury in Friday's 0-0 draw against the Houston Dash.

title: James blasts FIFA 'injustice' over León CWC axing
content: León captain James Rodríguez and coach Eduardo Berizzo urged FIFA on Friday to reconsider booting the Mexican team from the Club World Cup

title: Bayern threaten to sue Canada over Davies injury
content: Bayern Munich said they are considering legal action against the Canadian soccer federation following Alphonso Davies' serious knee injury.

title: Herdman reprimanded in Canada drone scandal
content: Following a disciplinary hearing, former Canada soccer coach John Herdman was formally admonished in writing for his involvement in a drone-spying scandal at the Paris Olympics.

title: Dani Alves sexual assault conviction overturned
content: The top court in Spain's Catalonia region said Friday it had overturned the conviction of Brazilian soccer player Dani Alves for sexual assault.

title: Barca, Madrid ... or Atletico -- who wins LaLiga?
content: LaLiga returns with Atleti, Barça and Madrid all after the title. ESPN's Alex Kirkland, Sam Marsden, Sid Lowe, Graham Hunter answer the key questions.

title: Experts' picks and best bets: Mikaela Mayer's jab, movement vs. Sandy Ryan's power
content: A boxing insider and a former opponent share their predictions for the Mikaela Mayer vs. Sandy Ryan rematch.

title: What the numbers tell us about Mayer vs. Ryan and Zepeda vs. Farmer
content: Two rematches on Saturday, one in Las Vegas, one in Mexico -- here's a look at the fights through the numbers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Sesko eyes Arsenal, Man United over Bayern or Milan
content: RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko has caught the eye of Arsenal, Man United, Milan and Bayern. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Understanding reached on next steps forward': Centre on trade talks with US
content: India and the US are set to finalize the first part of their Bilateral Trade Agreement by the end of 2025 after four days of productive talks in New Delhi. The agreement aims to expand trade to $500 billion by 2030, focusing on market access, reducing trade barriers, and integrating supply chains. Both nations are committed to ongoing collaboration.

title: Videos show chaos after Naypyitaw airport control tower collapses in quake
content: A 7.7 magnitude earthquake hit Myanmar's Naypyitaw, causing the airport's control tower to collapse and halting air traffic. The death toll exceeded 1,000, with extensive damage recorded in Mandalay and beyond. Ongoing civil conflict complicates rescue efforts, even as international aid arrives.

title: Tufts luck: 2 Indian-Americans in eye of ICE storm
content: Tufts University President Sunil Kumar and Judge Indira Talwani face criticism amid the detention and potential deportation of Turkish scholar Rumeysa Ozturk. Students and lawmakers decry the actions of federal authorities and demand stronger institutional support and condemnation of the Trump administration's policies.

title: Donald Trump imposes 25% import tariff on car imports; Musk responds
content: US President Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on auto imports and parts, which takes effect on April 3. This decision targets foreign-made cars, light trucks, and key auto parts. Elon Musk highlighted that these tariffs would increase the cost of parts in Tesla cars sourced from other countries.

title: 'Views badha lo': Aakash Chopra slams fake Dhoni commentary video
content: Aakash Chopra condemned a fan for editing his commentary to create a misleading video of MS Dhoni in the IPL 2025 match between CSK and RCB. The fake clip falsely linked Chopra's words to Dhoni’s arrival instead of his six. Despite CSK's defeat, Dhoni impressed with 30 not out, setting a new record for the team.

title: 15-hour-plus Raid on Amazon, Flipkart warehouses: Fake ISI mark products seized
content: The Bureau of Indian Standards has conducted extensive raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi targeting counterfeit and substandard products. Thousands of items, including geysers, food mixers, electrical appliances, and sports footwear lacking proper ISI certification, were seized with an estimated value of Rs 70 lakh.

title: Maha U-turn? No crop loan waiver for now, says dy CM Ajit Pawar
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar urged farmers to repay crop loans by March 31, emphasizing that election promises like loan waivers depend on future decisions and current circumstances. He assured 0% interest loans to ease the burden and highlighted the significant financial commitments the state faces.

title: 'My wife has 3-4 boyfriends': Gwalior man fears 'Meerut-like' murder plot
content: Amit Kumar Sen from Gwalior protested, accusing his wife and her boyfriends of planning to murder him, claiming they already killed his son. Despite multiple complaints, he alleges no police action has been taken, stressing the need for protection and investigation.

title: Watch: Heartwarming Dhoni-Raina reunion steals the spotlight
content: MS Dhoni and Suresh Raina's heartfelt reunion during the CSK vs RCB match delighted fans, while Dhoni became CSK's highest run-scorer, overtaking Raina's record. Despite Dhoni's efforts, CSK fell short of RCB's score, ending RCB's 17-year winless streak at Chepauk. The emotional evening also saw a warm moment between Virat Kohli and Raina.

title: How to create Ghibli-style Portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's GPT-4o update, which creates Studio Ghibli-style portraits, is currently restricted to paid subscription tiers due to high demand. However, users can still generate Ghibli-inspired art for free using alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI models, and other third-party tools, or by leveraging free trials on premium AI platforms.

title: ‘Digging with bare hands’: Rescuers describe horror as quake victims 'cry for help'
content: A devastating 7.7-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar has killed over 1,000 people, injured thousands, and left many trapped under rubble. Rescue efforts are hindered by a lack of heavy machinery. The military government has appealed for international aid, with initial assistance arriving from India and China.

title: Lahore-born New Zealand batter slams fastest fifty on ODI debut
content: New Zealand's Muhammad Abbas set a new record with the fastest debut fifty in ODIs, scoring 52 off 26 balls against Pakistan at McLean Park. The 21-year-old's impressive performance surpassed Krunal Pandya’s previous record. Supported by Mark Chapman's century, New Zealand secured a 73-run victory, taking a 1-0 lead in the series.

title: How killer techie fooled tenant, misled cops after killing wife in Bengaluru
content: Rakesh Rajendra Khedekar admitted to killing his wife, Gouri Anil Sambrekar, after a dispute over her job search and unemployment issues. Following the murder, he falsely informed a tenant that Gouri had committed suicide. Rakesh planned to surrender but was apprehended by police beforehand.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli shoves CSK's Khaleel in front of Dhoni
content: The IPL match between RCB and CSK was marked by a heated confrontation between Virat Kohli and Khaleel Ahmed. RCB secured a 50-run victory, breaking their Chepauk jinx. Kohli's frustration with Khaleel overshadowed the win, sparking fan discussions. RCB's batting and bowling performances were highlighted by contributions from Rajat Patidar, Tim David, Josh Hazlewood, and Yash Dayal.

title: What to eat, foods to avoid and food rules to follow during Surya Grahan
content: A partial solar eclipse, the first of 2025, will occur on March 29. It will be visible in the United States and India at specific times. The event is considered spiritually significant, especially in India, where dietary guidelines recommend sattvic foods and avoiding cooked food, non-vegetarian items, and stimulants.

title: Centre vs X: Govt slams Musk's platform for calling 'Sahyog' censorship tool
content: The Centre has criticised social media platform X for calling the 'Sahyog' portal a censorship tool, describing the claim as unfortunate and condemnable. It emphasized Section 69A's authority for blocking orders under specific conditions and defended the portal's role in addressing unlawful content.

title: 'Swift heartbroken, devastated over custody battle involving her godson'
content: Taylor Swift, godmother to Jaime King's son Leo Thames, remains supportive despite King's recent custody loss due to addiction struggles. Swift is committed to honoring her godmother role during King's recovery, highlighting her unwavering loyalty to personal relationships.

title: '10 times better': AB de Villiers praises RCB's squad balance
content: RCB's improved squad balance has been hailed by AB de Villiers after their impressive start in IPL 2025. With significant contributions from players like Bhuvneshwar Kumar, RCB have secured consecutive away victories against CSK and KKR. The team's depth and chemistry are major factors in their strong performance and promising start to the season.

title: Japan transforms cow dung into eco-friendly fuel for vehicles
content: Japan is using cow dung to create fuel for vehicles, reducing carbon emissions and managing agricultural waste. In Shikaoi, cow manure is converted into hydrogen for farm equipment and local businesses. This innovative process has caught global attention, with similar projects already being implemented in other regions. This technology presents a promising future for clean, renewable energy.

title: Rohit: 'Imagine if we'd won the final against Australia as well'
content: Rohit Sharma reflects on India's resilience and shift in mindset that led to impressive runs in ICC tournaments over the past nine months. Despite some setbacks, including a rare home Test series loss and a tough IPL season, India won the ICC Champions Trophy and T20 World Cup under his leadership.

title: 'Resolving conflict must be national priority': Rahul meets Manipur leaders
content: Rahul Gandhi met Manipur leaders amid ongoing violence and criticized PM Modi for not visiting the state. He urged for a national priority in resolving the crisis. Manipur has been under President's rule since February after the chief minister resigned due to ethnic violence between Meitei and Kuki-Zo tribes, resulting in over 250 deaths.

title: 'Not a terrorist': Sanjay Raut demands special protection for Kamra
content: Sanjay Raut demands special protection for comedian Kunal Kamra, who faces multiple legal cases over remarks about Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde. He compares Kamra's situation to that of Kangana Ranaut, who received security after a dispute with Shiv Sena, and calls for government intervention.

title: Man kills 5-month-old twin daughters in Raj over desire for son; arrested
content: In a tragic incident in Sikar district's Neem Ka Thana town, Ashok Kumar allegedly killed his nearly 5-month-old twin daughters due to his desire for a son. The crime was reported by the twins' mother, Anita, who revealed a history of harassment. Kumar buried the bodies, and police arrested him after being alerted by Anita's brother.

title: 'Whether we lose or win, we have to smile': Rohit shares MI mindset
content: Former MI skipper Rohit Sharma emphasises the importance of maintaining a positive attitude regardless of outcomes in a video shared by Mumbai Indians. He highlights resilience as key to MI's success. Despite an early defeat in IPL 2025, Rohit encourages the team to stay positive and keep fighting in the upcoming match against Gujarat Titans.

title: Moon sighting for Eid-ul-Fitr 2025: When to watch in India, UAE, and Saudi Arabia
content: The moon sighting is crucial because it marks the beginning of Shawwal, the month following Ramadan, and indicates the end of fasting. As we approach the end of Ramadan 2025, Muslims around the world are waiting for the official announcement that signals the start of Eid-ul-Fitr. Whether you're in India, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, or elsewhere, the exact timing can vary, but the excitement and spirit of celebration remain the same.

title: Girls called 'samaan': Self-proclaimed gurus target young girls from poor UP families
content: Sambhal police arrested 14 men involved in a gang that exploited young women under the guise of tantric rituals for wealth. The victims, from various districts in Uttar Pradesh, were subjected to sexual exploitation. Authorities discovered videos and images of the victims. Investigations revealed the gang targeted financially vulnerable families, promising them monetary gains.

title: 'India stands in solidarity': PM Modi speaks to Myanmar junta chief
content: Prime Minister Modi expressed condolences to Myanmar after a 7.7 magnitude earthquake caused widespread damage. India has launched 'Operation Brahma' to provide immediate relief, including tents, food, and medical supplies. Myanmar's military junta reports over 1,000 deaths and thousands injured, with rescue operations ongoing.

title: Rakesh Roshan: It’s the right time for Hrithik to take Krrish forward
content: Krrish is ingrained in Hrithik, so he's the best person to direct Krrish 4 and take the mantle ahead, reveals Rakesh Roshan.

title: Army intensifies hunt for terrorists in J&K’s Kathua, war-like stores found
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district intensified their search for remaining terrorists after an encounter resulted in the deaths of four policemen and two Pakistani terrorists. The ongoing 'Operation Safiyan' is conducted by the J&K Police, Army, NSG, BSF, and CRPF. War-like stores were recovered, including IED materials and grenades.

title: 3 centenarians reveal secret to long life – and it's not diet or exercise!
content: Longevity is what has kept the humanity intrigued for centuries. Is there a formula to it? Is there a secret that we don't know? One of the women, who was 100 years old, when asked what is the secret to being 100, said, "Do everything wrong, don't have diet coke, have regular coke, don't exercise, and most importantly, don't worry". She further went on to add that she likes coffee, has ice cream 'all the time', and still drinks alcohol.

title: Love triangle ends in marriage: Man marries 2 women in one ceremony; watch
content: Suryadev, a man from Lingapur mandal, married two women, Kanaka Lal and Atram Jalkar Devi, in a single ceremony following tribal customs. Village elders witnessed the event, which took place in Kumurambheem Asifabad district. Nearly 1,000 people from nearby villages attended the wedding. Suryadev signed a bond to pledge equal care for both brides.

title: 'Misrepresented': Indian-American student on Hinduism course by Houston University
content: An Indian-American student at Houston University has accused a Hinduism course of bias, alleging it misrepresented aspects of the Hindu religion and politically branded PM Narendra Modi as a Hindu fundamentalist. The university defended its course as academically rigorous and committed to exploring complex religious and political issues.

title: 'Minister's statement factual': Tharoor backs EAM's remarks on Pakistan's
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor expressed concern over the worsening treatment of minorities in Pakistan, highlighting disturbing incidents involving the Sikh, Ahmadiyya, and Christian communities. He emphasized the lack of dialogue between India and Pakistan, making it difficult to address these issues directly.

title: Indian Air Force civil engineer shot dead at home in UP
content: A civil engineer of the Indian Air Force was shot dead while sleeping at his official residence in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh. An unidentified assailant fired through the window, leading to the victim's death after being taken to the Army hospital. The incident is under investigation.

title: 'Slapped, gagged, stabbed': How Bengaluru techie stuffed wife into suitcase 'alive'
content: A 36-year-old man in Bengaluru, Rakesh Rajendra Khedekar, is suspected of premeditated murder after stabbing his wife, Gouri Anil Sambrekar, and attempting to hide her body in a suitcase during a domestic argument. Police believe he transported her to Bengaluru with the intent to kill her, following a series of deception efforts to mislead authorities.
